Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2014 05:43PM jamonthis wrote: See, there ya go.  It really isn't painful.  I am going back to work tomorrow.  Just feels heavy/sore and some yellowish bruising.  Most likely mine with be a fibroadenoma, as he reports he "thinks he got the whole thing out."  This is nothing compared to general surgery.  They may feel like a core biopsy or fine needle is appropriate.  But for me, I figured do it all now so I won't have to do more again later.  I like to overreact vs under react.  Maybe he can do yours easily, too.  Let us know.  Also, keep in your head that even those of us with dense breasts and birads 4 are 80% benign.  Those are really great odds.
Posts.Title: Birads 4 - biopsy on Thursday bunny78 bunny78

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2014 05:14PM jamonthis wrote: I think a lot of the time a biopsy takes the place of the MRI.  Ask the breast surgeon.  Birads 4 means 80% chance it will be benign.  I pushed for excisional biopsy, figuring they/I would want the mass out anyways.  I preferred one treatment to two (fine needle + excisional).  My mass was palpable and near the nipple so it was easy to excise.  They do it with deep sedation a lot of the time, so I had propofol and woke up feeling fine.  5 days later, I am waiting for results and yesterday and today there was a lot of bruising.  But glad I chose to remove it.
Posts.Title: Birads 4 - biopsy on Thursday bunny78 bunny78

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2014 11:09PM jamonthis wrote: OOh, ask your doc.  That would be a lovely trip if you can.  Otherwise, Alaska will wait for you.

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2014 06:39PM jamonthis wrote: I did worriedmom0 on Friday.  No pain until the past couple days.  Just a lot of yellowish bruising.  The more supportive the bra the better.  I go back to work tomorrow. It wasn't too bad, gotta say.
